thread.title: Barcelona and Monaco have 100 goals in 2016/17, Arsenal came in 4th
thread.title_full: Barcelona and Monaco have 100 goals in 2016/17, Arsenal came in 4th

title: Barcelona and Monaco have 100 goals in 2016/17, Arsenal came in 4th
text:
Barcelona Only teams to reach mark Barcelona and Monaco have 100 goals in 2016/17 Shared Updated 06/02/2017 11:01 CET 
T he first European team to reach 100 goals this season were Barcelona , followed a few minutes later by Monaco. 
Paco Alcacer, Lionel Messi and Aleix Vidal saw the Catalans get to the mark last Saturday against Athletic Club, whilst the French side ran out comfortable 3-0 winners against Nice to join them at the top of the list of teams with most goals in 2016/17. 
In third place is Real Madrid, who have scored 98 goals, although they've played 2 games less than Barcelona. 
Well behind are Premier League leaders Chelsea and Bayern Munich, both of whom have scored just 67 goals. 31% down to Messi 
Sixteen Barcelona players have contributed to the centenary of goals and Messi, with 31, is the top scorer. 
He is followed by Luis Suarez on 22, while Arda Turan has surprisingly outperformed Neymar to come in third. 
The Turkish international has 13 with the Brazilian not even into double figures yet (9). 
Monaco's Radamel Falcao is well over the serious knee injury he had and is their current top scorer with 20 goals. Teams with most goals
